intro: Dysoxylum cyrtobotryum var. borneense, commonly known as the Bornean ironwood, is a tropical tree native to the island of Borneo. It is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood that is highly valued for its durability and strength. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is typically found in lowland rainforests. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white flowers followed by spherical fruits. The species is also noted for its ecological importance in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
